title.native: 魔法少女まどか☆マギカ

description:
One night, 14-year-old Madoka Kaname has a terrible nightmare - against the backdrop of a devastated city, she witnesses a girl fight a losing battle against a dreadful being lingering above, while a cat-like magical creature tells Madoka the only way to change such tragic outcome is for her to make a contract with him and become a magical girl.

The next day, the teen's dream seemingly becomes reality as the girl she saw in her dream - Homura - arrives at Mitakihara Middle School as a transfer student, mysteriously warning Madoka to stay just the way she is; but when later on she and her best friend Sayaka encounter the same cat-like magical creature from her dream - who introduces himself as Kyubey - the pair discovers that magical girls are real, and what's more, they can choose to become one. All they must do is sign a contract with Kyubey and agree to take on the duty to fight abstract beings called 'witches' that spread despair to the human world, and in return, each one of them will be granted any single wish they desire. However, as Homura's omen suggests, there might be far more to becoming a magical girl than Madoka and Sayaka realize...

Notes:
- Due to the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami, the broadcasts of episodes 11 and 12 were delayed and were later aired as a double feature on April 21, 2011.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Mixed Media
tags.description: Features a combination of different media and animation techniques. Often seen with puppetry, textiles, live action footage, stop motion, and more. This does not include works with normal usage of CGI in their production.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

__Height:__ 156cm

Non-anime roles:
- Honoka - Azur Lane (VG)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Website](https://erikitamura.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KITAxERI) | [King Records](http://king-cr.jp/artist/kitaeri/)

A Japanese voice actress and singer. She used to be a child actress by the name of Eri Okamura. 

She is primarily known for her role in Blood+ as Saya Otonashi and singing "Tsuyogari," the third ending for the anime series Konjiki No Gash Bell!! She is also known to be an amateur manga artist in Japan in her spare time. Kitamura is affiliated with talent agency Early Wing and was formerly affiliated with Kaleidoscope.

Currently works in the music unit ARTERY VEIN with Asami Imai. Also provides the voice of CUL, a Vocaloid.

__Doujinshi Circle:__ apricot+

[Website](http://ap.sakuraweb.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/umeaoki)

Ume Aoki is a Japanese manga artist, illustrator and dōjin artist from Hyogo Prefecture. She officially romanizes her name as aokiume. She illustrates under the pennames apricot+ for many of her dojinshi, and Apply Fujimiya for the visual novel Sanarara.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/新房昭之) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akiyuki_Shinbo)

Akiyuki Shinbou is a Japanese director, producer, animator and storyboard artist. He joined Studio One Pattern in 1981. He made his directorial debut with [Metal Fighter Miku](https://anilist.co/anime/1175/) in 1994. He joined Shaft in 2004. He has received the 11th Tokyo Anime Award and the 2011 Newtype Anime Award for Best director for his work on the acclaimed anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/).

Shinbou was born in Fukushima Prefecture. After high school, he attended Tokyo Designer Institute before entering the anime industry.

After graduating from Tokyo Design Institute, Shinbou worked as an animator for the 1981 anime series [Urusei Yatsura](https://anilist.co/anime/1293/). Shinbou participated with Studio Pierrot in 1990 as an episode director in [Musashi](https://anilist.co/anime/8065/). His first full directorial debut was however the previously mentioned, with Metal Fighter Miku. He continued his early directional career with several OVA series in the late 90's. Shinbou participated with Seven Arcs starting with [Triangle Heart: Sweet Songs Forever](https://anilist.co/anime/176/) in 2003 and then became director for 2004's spin-off [Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha](https://anilist.co/anime/76/).

His style in particular became noticed during his episode direction work on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392/)'s Dark Tournament arc. After seeing Shinbou's stylized presence, the new president of Shaft, [Mitsutoshi Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/151830/), approached Shinbou with the desire to make Shaft a distinctive studio among animation companies. In an interview, Kubota cited [Le Portrait de Petit Cossette](https://anilist.co/anime/514/) and [The SoulTaker](https://anilist.co/anime/1048/) among Shinbou's most distinctive products that caught his eye.

His work at Shaft has been characterized by extensive experimentation within the visual medium of animation, and often includes pictures taken from real life cut into scenes, as well as art shifts, beat panels, kabuki sound effects, textures that remain stationary when the textured object moves, showing symbols or defining parts of a character in place of characters during dialogue, written text in place (in opposition to dialogue), precise use of fan service, and "head-tilting", a style known as a Shaft specialty.

He says that the reason he sticks with Shaft is due to their system and professional capacity, which make his expression of direction much easier. The so-called "Team Shinbou" includes himself, [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and [Shin Oonuma](https://anilist.co/staff/101753/).

(Source: Wikipedia)
Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

**Height:** 145 cm (4'9")
**Nicknames:** Ao-chan (あおちゃん), Kodomo sensei (こども先生, lit. Child teacher)
__Agency:__ Aoni Production

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)
- Renne Bright - Eiyuu Densetsu: Sen no Kiseki IV (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Hajimari no Kiseki (VG), Eiyuu Densetsu: Kuro no Kiseki (VG)
- Yurusen - Kamen Rider Ghost (VG)
- Fiona - Xenoblade Chronicles 3 (VG)
- Rita Rossweisse - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Moddey - Memento Mori (VG)
- Futaba Sakura - Persona 5/Royal (VG)
- Pascal - NieR: Automata (VG) (VG)
- Nian - Arknights (VG)
- Istina - Arknights (VG)
- Ravi & Apocalyptic Ravi - Epic 7 (VG)
- Schneider - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Lysithea - Fire Emblem: Three Houses (VG)
- Cinderella - Nikke: Goddess of Victory (VG)
- Sugar - Reverse Collapse: Code Name Bakery (VG)

[Official Website](http://www.kalafina.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kalafina_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnRbD__LEKBj_ZR_dC8KmzQ)

Kalafina were a Japanese band formed by composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/Yuki-Kajiura) in 2007 to mainly perform theme songs for the [Kara no Kyoukai](https://anilist.co/anime/2593/Kara-no-Kyoukai-Fukan-Fuukei/) anime movies, but since expanded to many other theme songs for other anime shows and films.

Main vocals and backgrounds are provided by a different member each time. For example, Wakana is in charge of the main vocals in Oblivious and Lacrimosa, while the main vocals in Aria are done by Hikaru. In others songs each of them sings a stanza. Wakana and Keiko are also members of Yuki Kajiura's [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691/FictionJunction) project. 

Spacecraft agency officially announced disbandment on March 13, 2019 after Kajiura, Keiko, and Hikaru left the agency in 2018.

In January 2025, the three members will reunite for the first time in six years to hold "Kalafina Anniversary LIVE 2025" at the Tokyo Garden Theater, with Takebe Satoshi serving as musical director.

__Members:__
• [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/) (梶浦由記) - Composer

• Keiko - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664/) (窪田啓子/ケイコ) - Vocalist
• Wakana - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈/ワカナ) - Vocalist
• Hikaru - [Hikaru Masai](https://anilist.co/staff/168857/) (政井光/ヒカル) - Vocalist

• Maya Toyoshima (豊島摩耶) - Vocalist, participated only in "ARIA"/"sprinter", left the group in 2009

__Support:__
• Remi Tanaka (田中玲美/REMI) - Background vocalist
• [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489/) (貝田由里子) - Background vocalist
• Hanae Tomaru (戸丸華江) - Background vocalist

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

Sergei Vasilievich Rachmaninoff was a Russian composer, pianist, and conductor. Rachmaninoff is widely considered one of the finest pianists of his day and, as a composer, one of the last great representatives of Romanticism in Russian classical music.
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/).
Affiliated with [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/) since 2004.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jacomamire)

Shingo Suzuki is an animator previously belonging to Gonzo and Satelight and now affiliated with GoHands.  He was being influenced by Masami Obari and Fumihide Sai and is particularly known for his bold and peculiar shading and high level drawings.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

Gen Urobuchi is a Japanese novelist and screenwriter. He is a key member of the video game and visual novel developer [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/studio/459/Nitroplus) and currently serves as the company's representative director and vice-president.

He is best known as the co-creator of the highly acclaimed and commercially successful anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magica/), which earned him the Tokyo Anime Award for Best Scriptwriter. His other major works include the acclaimed Nitroplus-developed visual novel, *Saya no Uta*, the anime series [PSYCHO-PASS](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/PSYCHOPASS/), the light novel and anime series [Fate/Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/10087/FateZero/), and the tokusatsu TV show *Kamen Rider Gaim*. Urobuchi is one of the most renowned and prolific writers in the anime industry.

Anime series written by Urobuchi that have won the Newtype Anime Award have been Puella Magi Madoka Magica in 2011, Fate/Zero in 2012 and [Psycho-Pass: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/20514/PSYCHOPASS-The-Movie/) in 2015.

A film buff, Urobuchi likes to include film homages in his works. He has named Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Sergio Leone, and John Carpenter to be his favorite directors. As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)
